metadata.title: CVE-2019-3880 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the way samba implemented an RPC endpoint emulating theWindows registry service API. An unprivileged attacker could use this flawto create a new registry hive file anywhere they have unix permissionswhich could lead to creation of a new file in the Samba share. Versionsbefore 4.8.11, 4.9.6 and 4.10.2 are vulnerable.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3880` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
libnss-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
libpam-winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
libsmbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
libwbclient0 - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
python-samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
registry-tools - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
samba - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
samba-common - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
samba-common-bin - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
samba-libs - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
samba-testsuite - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
smbclient - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
winbind - 2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.7.6+dfsg~ubuntu-0ubuntu2.9').
